html:
1.17.25  9:59 am   do you enjoy answering these questions?

      yes but it's not the only thing i enjoy

1.17.25  7:45 am   what is your signature play?

      doing something that you did not think would have been my signature play

1.17.25  5:37 am   what shouldn't i do next?  what activities should i avoid under any circumstances?

      perhaps don't destroy the universe

1.17.25  4:30 am   What is your favourite accidental invention that just so became successful

      the wheel

1.17.25  3:14 am   why shouldnt i run with scissors?

      the scissors are already there, at your destination. you don't need to bring them

1.17.25  2:03 am   why do some peoples sit on the floor and have low tables while others have chairs and relatively higher tables

      just trying to see what works

1.17.25  12:37 am   Did you know that you can't wear white after Labor Day?

      oh i got it backwards

1.17.25  12:36 am   How do you practice common sense?

      how about opening a can of worms

1.17.25  12:10 am   Since David Lynch has just died, have you engaged with any of his work?

      that's not usually my reason for engaging with someone's work

1.16.25  11:41 pm   What's the worst thing about music

      the confusing conversations trying to understand what it's actually doing to things

1.16.25  10:02 pm   Do you think you've lived up to your full potential, or have you fallen short? why? 

      i'm half way there. feel free to measure that on whatever logarithmic scale you like

1.16.25  8:26 pm   I hate my own nationality what can I do

      maybe just pretend it's different

1.16.25  8:14 pm   Why do other animals not have mustaches and beards

      they still have hair everywhere. which is probably less weird actually

1.16.25  8:07 pm   bill am i going to pass my exams

      i'm not sure

1.16.25  5:26 pm   What is the most unusual/unexpected place you've gotten musical inspiration from?

      when i've been staring directly at the song for too long searching for the 'answer'. In other words, if i actually did get any inspiration in that scenario, that would be extremely unexpected

1.16.25  5:10 pm   Tom is painting a fence 100 feet long. He starts at the West end of the fence and paints at a rate of 5 feet per hour. After 2 hours, Huck joins Tom and begins painting from the East end of the fence at a rate of 8 feet per hour. After 2 hours of the two boys painting at the same time, Tom leaves Huck to finish the job by himself.

If Huck completes painting the entire fence after Tom leaves, how many more hours will Huck work than Tom?

      that's none of my business

1.16.25  5:08 pm   i've put all my song ideas i can think of into a big list, but i'm scared to use a randomizer to pick one, because what if it's one i don't like and i'm stuck with it?

      you actually can compromise between choice and non-choice by going through the list and choosing exactly one third of the items, and put only that 1/3 list to a random selection. i think this will feel just that extra bit warmer, while still being loads of fun. and i think you're gonna be pleasantly surprised at the selection

1.16.25  4:38 pm   Hi Bill, I would be very very happy and helped if you would recommend which process you generally do first; Do you animate your background and setting first, or do you animate the characters and their details first and do the background after?

      i'm still deep in the process of figuring out why both ways are in fact the wrong way

1.16.25  4:13 pm   what do you think of pets having human names? for instance i have a cat named dave, i've heard of maybe a dog named mark. additionally, thoughts on humans with pet names? a father and lawyer named snowball perhaps. 

      people talk about pets' names so much sometimes it makes me even wonder if there is a real animal involved

1.16.25  3:57 pm   What is the most difficult phoneme to pronounce?

      i suspect the north american / irish 'R'

1.16.25  2:17 pm   do you handle super hot weather better or super cold weather better

      what kind of numbers are we talking about

1.16.25  1:15 pm   Do you think the Germans regret going through the High German consonant shift? I would be disappointed if they took my /t/, /p/, and /k/ sounds and made them lame and weak. 'ik' is truly the pinnacle of first person singular, compare it with the icky (or ichy?)'ich'. 

      heck, soms sta ik maar in een windmolen gewoon 'ik' zeggen tegen mezelf de hele dag

1.16.25  12:30 pm   have you ever been to the middle of nowhere

      i have been around the edges of nowhere

1.16.25  12:11 pm   When next song please

      i'm going to put out so many songs you're barely even gonna remember wondering about the next one right now

1.16.25  12:04 pm   bill how will you reach the point where you've done concerts so regularly that they become comfortable? will you have to hold uncomfortable concerts first?

      yes

1.16.25  11:17 am   ok, so, i am once again getting overwhelmed by the high number of songs i want to finish and the large amount of time and effort it takes to finish each one of them, and i find myself jumping between projects and not making much progress. How do you recommend going about Choosing what to work on and Sticking with it?

      if your situation gets bad enough, one day it will be enough just to know that it's even possible to choose 1. you will have almost forgotten about that simple ticket to higher ground, and you will leap for joy once it occurs to you to do that

1.16.25  11:09 am   hi bill can you assure me that everything will be okay and that i will live the rest of my life loved

      there are usually a lot of ups and downs in life, no matter how good or bad your circumstances are

1.16.25  10:32 am   any chords that you dislike or don't ever use (whether intentionally or unintentionally)?

      i doubt it

1.16.25  10:25 am   what's the difference between wacky and wacko

      i think in this case you can get away with a wide range of uses for those words. they don't seem firmly standardized, and their stylistic usage can vary over relatively short periods of time

1.16.25  10:02 am   how do i get my friends to stop hating me

      figure out who your friends actually are

1.16.25  9:18 am   Are thoughts made of electricity?

      hmmmm............. there is probably electricity involved but that's not the whole story

1.16.25  9:02 am   can you help me with AP physics? what the heck is a force function?

      i'm not sure. i certainly didn't take that class, and i don't even know what AP stands for. That being said, i'm very familiar with the acceleration rate of gravity on planet earth, and am capable of making the relevant calculations in order to achieve the desired parabolic results

1.16.25  7:59 am   Best part of New York and why

      you've probably heard of it

1.16.25  3:57 am   are you american

      i'll admit, it sure sounds like it, based on the way i would pronounce words like 'carbon fiber'

1.16.25  2:55 am   Why does "can't you" mean "can you"?

      sometimes "can't you" means "you should be able to, right?" other times it means "i'm a little annoyed that you haven't, because i think you can"

1.16.25  2:30 am   do you enjoy long walks on the beach

      no but i enjoy long walks on firm pavement

1.16.25  12:30 am   You been testing any doors lately Bill?

      i was going to say no but now that i think about it yes

1.15.25  11:03 pm   what's a good way to surprise yourself?  it seems tricky, since you'd be aware that you were planning to surprise yourself and so you'd be expecting it

      leave something somewhere

1.15.25  9:40 pm   do you watch anime?

      no, but don't worry, other people do

1.15.25  9:28 pm   are you ever walking around and you come face to face with a mountain and you're like "damn these things are just everywhere"

      yes

1.15.25  8:52 pm   Do you find that critiquing a thing increases or decreases your enjoyment of it

      for me it multiplies the feeling, whether positive or negative. negative values multiply further into the negative direction, while positive values become more positive. if i have neutral feelings, my feelings may become even more profoundly neutral. that may seem hard to believe

1.15.25  8:38 pm   bill will you ever do a Logic session and break down the tracks of one of your songs? i'm very curious to see what's going on in there

      i'll explain it all much much later. it's very exciting but first i have to make about 1000 more songs in my lifetime

1.15.25  8:32 pm   If you were to hold a concert, what do you envision your set to look like? Would you want more of a Tiny Desk sort of thing?  Any preferences on the amount of people at the concert? Would it be more improvisational preferred to just singing older songs? I think a concert would be #awesome and I know you have had an interest in doing one for a long time. If you do, come to Florida!!!

      the first major difference on this between my mindset and yours is the number of concerts. i would not feel comfortable until they are happening on a regular basis, until they are familiar like a tuesday

1.15.25  7:24 pm   At what specific point does a tree become a christmas tree?

      probably when the lights go on

1.15.25  6:52 pm   why do you think so many people here are worried about not having an original question?

      maybe they are jealous of the other people trying to have original questions and don't want to feel left out

1.15.25  5:55 pm   can you give a very serious answer to the next question you get

      my answer to the next question will be influenced only by that question and not at all by this one. that being said, it almost seems like the kind of answer you are looking for might be more readily available right here, on this question

1.15.25  5:19 pm   what is your obsession with the } symbol

      it works

1.15.25  5:04 pm   What could be your goal in your Lifetime?

      sometimes i like to not announce my goals publicly. better to surprise the world with them. i have done that in the past, but i plan to do it even more in the future

1.15.25  4:46 pm   can you not reply to this question?

      i'll see what i can do

1.15.25  3:03 pm   is it true that in order for something perfect to survive in this world, it must move ever farther away from perfection?

      it seems to me that anything 'perfect' has no perturbations in the fabric of reality and therefore cannot be perceived. it has no characteristics and is completely invisible
